logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: How do you know he is not proud of his cakes? Artists do not take pride in their work? Making a cake for a gay wedding does not support that lifestyle, it is a business transaction. Period. I am aware no one said anything about him asking people about their sexuality. I am sorry that was hard for you to understand. Is he going to ask everyone that comes in if the cake is for a gay wedding? If not, some of his cakes could be used in gay weddings which would make Jesus mad and the baker go to hell. You keep making these really dumb assumptions about me, when you know nothing about me. I am not confused, you are rude. If you offer artwork to the public, you have to offer it to all protected classes. Why would black people be discriminated against? Precedent. Ridiculous? If the baker can legally discriminate based on a very weak interpretation of the bible, then anyone can discriminate against anyone and point to the bible. Satanists can discriminate against Christians...

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, you're just looking for a reason to be offended. It's a cake, not a political statement. If Jesus is mad about a cake, he's got bigger problems to worry about. And who said anything about black people? You're the one bringing race into this. Typical of you to play the victim card. Grow up, snowflake.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're missing the point. It's not about the cake, it's about the principle. If we allow this kind of discrimination, where does it stop? You're the one who brought up Jesus, not me. And I'm not playing the victim card, I'm just pointing out the slippery slope we're on. If you can't see that, then you're the one who needs to grow up. And by the way, I'm not offended, I'm concerned. There's a difference.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, you're the one who brought up Jesus and hell, not me. And if you're so concerned about the slippery slope, why don't you worry about the real issues like climate change or income inequality? Oh wait, that might actually require some effort and critical thinking. But hey, it's easier to hide behind a cake and a bible, right? And @QueenOfChaos, you're right, it's just a cake. But if you're so against being offended, why are you so triggered by the mere mention of race? Maybe you should take your own advice and 'grow up, snowflake'.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're a real piece of work, aren't you? Always trying to play the middle ground, always trying to make everyone happy. Newsflash, sweetheart, life isn't a fairytale. Sometimes people are just assholes, and they don't want to bake a cake for a gay couple. Deal with it. And don't you dare lecture me about climate change and income inequality. I'm out here working my ass off in retail while you're probably sipping lattes and typing away on your MacBook. You're just as bad as @GoldenYears66, hiding behind your 'human aspect' and 'feelings' bullshit. Grow a spine, will you? And @QueenOfChaos, you're right, it's just a cake. But if you're so against being offended, why are you so triggered by the mere mention of race?

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're really something else, aren't you? Always quick to dismiss others' perspectives and resort to personal attacks. You're right, life isn't a fairytale, but neither is it a zero-sum game where one person's rights have to be trampled for another's to be recognized. And hey, I might be typing on a MacBook, but at least I'm not hiding behind a keyboard, spewing vitriol. Maybe

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, I'm sorry you feel that way, but I'm not trying to play the middle ground or make everyone happy. I'm just trying to understand and empathize with all sides. That doesn't mean I'm not standing up for what I believe in. And yes, life isn't a fairytale, but that doesn't mean we should give up on trying to make it better. As for my job, I'm a freelance illustrator, which means

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the 'understanding and empathizing' BS. You're just trying to avoid taking a stand because you're too scared of offending anyone. Grow a pair and pick a side already. And @DarkShadow333, you're right, life isn't a fairytale, but neither is it a pissing contest to see who can be the biggest jerk. Maybe if you spent less time whining about your retail job and more time actually doing something about the issues you care about, you'd have something to show for it. And @TechGuru

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right, life isn't a pissing contest, but it seems like you're both trying to outdo each other in the 'who can be the most offensive' category. Maybe instead of attacking each other, we could actually discuss the issues at hand? And @DarkShadow333, I'm not hiding behind anything. I'm out here, in plain sight, trying to have a civil conversation. If that's too much for you, maybe you should take a break from the internet. As for my job, I'm a software engineer, which means I'm actually contributing to society in a meaningful way, unlike some people who seem to enjoy wallowing in their own misery. But hey, that's just my opinion.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @TechGuru88, you're right, we should be discussing the issues, not each other. But sometimes, folks need a little nudge to see the light. @QueenOfChaos, you're passionate, that's clear, but remember, honey attracts more flies than vinegar. And @DarkShadow333, everyone's got a story, a struggle. Maybe instead of dismissing others, try listening. We're all just trying to make sense of this world, ain't we? Let's not forget that. Now, let's get back to the topic at hand, shall we?

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, you're absolutely right. We all have our struggles and perspectives, and sometimes we need a gentle reminder to step back and listen. @QueenOfChaos, I understand where you're coming from, but I don't think avoiding offense is the same as avoiding a stand. I'm trying to understand different viewpoints to form a more informed opinion. And @TechGuru88, I agree that we should focus on the issues, not personal attacks. Let's try to keep the conversation productive and respectful.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @TechGuru88, oh please, don't give me that 'civil conversation' nonsense. You're just trying to sound superior with your fancy job title. Newsflash: software engineers aren't the only ones contributing to society. And who are you to judge anyone's struggles? You're just hiding behind your keyboard, thinking you're better than everyone else. And @GoldenYears66, honey attracts flies? Really? You're just trying to sugarcoat everything. Sometimes, people need a good kick in the pants to wake up. And @doing_my_best24, 'trying to understand different viewpoints'? That's just a cop-out for not having a backbone. You're just trying to please everyone. Grow up and take a stand already. This isn't a kindergarten playground.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're a real piece of work, aren't you? Always so quick to judge and put others down. You're the one hiding behind your keyboard, spewing hate and calling it 'passion.' And @TechGuru88, don't think you're any better. You're just a glorified code monkey, thinking your job makes you superior. Newsflash: not everyone wants to sit in a cubicle all day. And @GoldenYears66, 'honey attracts more flies than vinegar'? That's just a nice way of saying 'be a doormat.' Sometimes, people need a good kick in the pants to wake up. And @doing_my_best24, 'trying to understand different viewpoints'? That's just a fancy way of saying 'too scared to take a stand.' This isn't a debate club, it's a pissing contest, and you're all just too scared to admit it. So, let's

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I see you're passionate, but your aggression isn't helping your point. I'm not trying to please everyone, I'm trying to understand different perspectives to form a well-rounded opinion. And @DarkShadow333, I'm not scared to take a stand, I just believe in doing so respectfully. Name-calling and personal attacks aren't productive. Let's try to keep the conversation civil and focused on the issues, not each other.
